data.title: Accept synonyms in the fuzzyfinder
data.body:
support/c1480c969fbf11e39822f9a01bbb8911?page=1

People have been looking for "syntax" in the command palette when the actual term in atom "grammar". It'd be nice if we could have something like keywords for certain terms like:

file/buffer
syntax/grammar

data.title: Humans don't know what buffers are
data.body: @nathansobo and I beefed about whether we should call files "buffers" in the menus, the place where people least likely to understand the concept of Buffers will live. I think we came to an approximate consensus but I figured I should record the request here.

data.title: Update syntax color variables
data.body:
My proposal for new syntax variables. Fixes #1609 
- New syntax themes would have this file generated for them

I want your feedback on naming. Am I missing something? I will be updating all the themes to include these...

Part of me wants to have things like `@comment-color` and `@string-color`, but maybe we stick to only colors that are common in every syntax theme.

data.title: It'd be nice (from a mouse user perspective) if clicking/opening a new file would focus it
data.body:
support/998aa6269fc111e399e2c8692d00c69d?page=1

I often do something like this:
1. Click new file to open it
2. `cmd`+`k` `arrow` to split the pane
3. Fail because the file tree is still open.

I wish when a file opened that it'd automatically focus.

This might mess up the non-mouse workflow so I'm not entirely sure what we should do but something worth thinking about.

data.title: cmd + t doesn't work if you close all windows
data.body:
support/b62ac6b69fc211e387a72d6e148f9cfd?page=1

If I close all my atom windows and hit `cmd`+`t` I expect that it will create a new buffer but instead it does nothing. This may be by design but it makes things a little difficult.

data.title: 'USA International' keyboard layout does strange things with quotations marks
data.body:
From support/e5d60b969fa411e3895c419496c55cda

```
The problem is when I insert quotation marks. Because the quote key works for acute accent, I'm getting the following when I press a single quote a single time:

''r' -> when I press ' + r
'รก' -> when I press ' + a
```

data.title: Unify "settings" and "preferences"
data.body:
support/6d1d78ea9fc411e389dac4255fbdff74

It's been mentioned a few times that clicking Atom > Preferences goes to "settings" which is a little weird.

data.title: The atom cli fails to open files with spaces in the name.
data.body:
To reproduce

``` sh
echo "you won't see this text" > "file with spaces.txt" && atom "file with spaces.txt"
```

data.title: Copy/Paste in the context menu
data.body:
support/f9c3f1069fc511e39bd9868d96959cda?page=1

I'd be nice to be able to select text, right click, then choose "copy" from the context menu.

data.title: Renaming could be smoother
data.body: This was [mentioned by a user](support/f0322daa9fc611e38a443a454e3fd3af?page=1) but it's been kind of irking me as well. When you rename a file it pops up a modal out of the tree context that renames the file, and requires an `enter` press. I often do this and then unfocus the modal expecting the name to be applied but it doesn't (since I didn't hit enter). It'd be nice if this happened right in the file tree (on the file itself) and didn't require an enter press.

data.title: Open last project on startup
data.body:
When you quit sublime with a project open, the next time you launch it that project is opened automatically. I kind of miss that, and it's been requested by users too:

support/3db6a8fc9fc811e39580cc1dd8668139?page=1

data.title: Navigate packages in the settings list with keyboard commands
data.body:
support/f96903ba9fc811e38844f9159f8f1555?page=1

It might be nice to navigate the package settings list via up and down arrows

data.title: control leading and trailing invisibles separately
data.body:
support/b18ce4c49fca11e3846f4a35112c6ce3?page=1

It'd be interesting to consider adding control over showing leading and trailing whitespace differently with "show invisibles"

data.title: Autofill selected text for find is inconsistent
data.body:
support/9eb73adc9fcc11e3909d95b1750553b4?page=1

When you select text and hit `cmd`+`f`, the text autofills into the find form. If you try to do this a second time, it doesn't. It looks like this feature only works as long as the find field is empty. This could be by design but it might be nice if any selected text would be autofilled.

data.title: Show an indicator of which pane is active
data.body:
It was suggested that we indicate which pane you have focused when you're working with split panes. This might be nice to have.

support/936135889fcd11e38c27cd45c4cc96b2?page=1

data.title: Developer Tools infinitely repeat what people type.
data.body: Reported http://discuss.atom.io/t/developer-tools-infinitely-repeat-what-i-type/1150/3 and support/ebd219469f3011e39c5a5e36a4ad4a06

data.title: Min-width for keybindings columns
data.body: A [user mentioned](support/9ff63aae9fce11e38e757e24c35160b5?page=1) that when the atom window is a narrow width, it's impossible to use the keybindings page, as the overflow clips off all the information. It'd be nice if we did something like set a `min-width` on the columns and let the table scroll sideways if the page is too small.

data.title: DOM Inspector highlighting sticks if you use the shortcut to close dev tools
data.body:
> I am pretty sure that you already know that one but in Atom 0.60.0 and OS X 10.9.2 if you open the workspace view and close it (option+command+i) while the mouse pointer is over an element of the DOM (making it highlight), if you close the workspace view the highlight is stuck in the view forever.

From: support/be37042ea01b11e396030a8a76ef71b0

I did this as well, and it looks like it does keep it in that DOM inspector mode highlighting everything. A few clicks clears it.

data.title: Shortcuts and Documentation out of sync
data.body:
> In the https://atom.io/docs/v0.62.0/creating-a-package documentation page on section Stylesheets the text says that to open the Styleguide the shortcut is "command-control-G" but actually is "command-control-shift-G"

From: support/638a3ea4a0bd11e39e75473d03a46f17

Another person mentioned this too (can't find it now) so there may be a few others. 

:heart:

data.title: atom -h throws CFAllocator messages
data.body:
```
A error/debug message is printed when running `atom -h`:

$ atom -h
2014-02-26 19:29:14.825 Atom[66299:507] Internals of CFAllocator not known; out-of-memory failures via CFAllocator will not result in termination. http://crbug.com/45650
Atom Editor v0.59.0

Usage: atom [options] [file ...]

Options:
-d, --dev Run in development mode. [boolean]
-f, --foreground Keep the browser process in the foreground. [boolean]
-h, --help Print this usage message. [boolean]
-l, --log-file Log all output to file. [string]
-n, --new-window Open a new window. [boolean]
-s, --spec-directory Set the directory from which specs are loaded (default: Atom's spec directory). [string]
-t, --test Run the specified specs and exit with error code on failures. [boolean]
-v, --version Print the version. [boolean]
-w, --wait Wait for window to be closed before returning. [boolean]
```

From: support/85cfec129f4f11e39023acbff144d3b9

data.title: When soft wrapping, the cursor gets behind by one character.
data.body:
What it says on the tin. :grin:

> When soft wrapping, the cursor gets behind by one character.

From support/6996221a9f4e11e3988dab2cdf1dc670

data.title: Right ALT Not supported (bad for International Keyboards)
data.body:
> Atom doesn't handle keyboards with Right Alt (i.e. AltGr). This is a very basic mistake. I have a Hungarian keyboard layout, I can only write specific keys like "|" (pipe) by pressing Right Alt (AltGr) and then W, which Atom doesn't recognize and treat like Alt-W or something?
> The point is there are some layouts like greek, hungarian, czech with special keys, which an EDITOR should handle the right way!!
> E.g. I can't write CTRL-", because it writes the number "2" instead. I think this key might be interpreted like CTRL-ALT sequence, but not sure either.
> Anyway, without it, it's just not an editor.
> Like Windows Media player; you can't pause a movie with it hitting space bar...

From: support/9f98abca9f4a11e3955c6445541b1a76

data.title: Clicking Atom -> View License with no Window open Fails
data.body:
Close all your windows (not just buffers), click Atom -> View License, nothing happens. 

From: support/5c3363c29f4811e3828e6fdbe3ebc488

:heart:

data.title: Fix freezes related to the editor's width in characters being assigned to non-positive integers
data.body: Fixes #1574

data.title: Fix row map corruption
data.body: This should fix at least some of the translation errors in display buffer. Hopefully all of them.

data.title: Triage
data.body:
We're overloaded. I'm hoping this issue can be used to help us prioritize things.
### High Priority
- Respond to PRs on Atom Packages
- Respond to open issues
- Fix high frequency or security bugs 
### Medium Priority
- Respond and moderate discuss.atom.io
- Respond to halp tickets
### Low Priority
- Fix bugs reported by bugsnag
- IRC
### Decisions that need to be made
- [x] Should we remove the atom@github.com email address from atom.io?
- [ ] Should we make the feedback package send people to discuss.atom.io?
- [x] The Vim package is the most popular package. Do we want to foster that excitement and have dedicate someone to maintaining the package and responding to the PRs and Issues?

data.title: space-pen documentation doesn't include extension functions
data.body:
See http://atom.io/docs/api/v0.61.0/api/classes/View.html

Currently it's missing functions defined in [jquery-extensions.coffee](https://github.com/atom/space-pen/blob/master/src/jquery-extensions.coffee) like `::preeempt` and `::command` which is confusing for developers.

Reported here originally atom/vim-mode#87

data.title: Highlight text, right click, text is deselected
data.body:
You might want to autocomplete, spellcheck or find the symbol, but the text is deselected.

https://twitter.com/krainboltgreene/status/439309326789124096

data.title: Provide breakpad symbols of native modules
data.body:
This PR adds the `dump-symbols` task which would generate debug symbols for all the native modules, and the symbols would be uploaded to GitHub Release when publishing build.

/cc @kevinsawicki I don't know how the official build is deployed, can you help make sure the `atom-mac-symbols.zip` is uploaded when publishing a release in atom/atom?

data.title: Fix CSON syntax for keybinding example in docs
data.body:

The prose and the syntax in this article don't match.
